[ { "answer": "unanswerable", "answers": null, "context": "Commonly called 'light bulbs', lamps are the removable and replaceable part of a light fixture, which converts electrical energy into electromagnetic radiation. While lamps have traditionally been rated and marketed primarily in terms of their power consumption, expressed in watts, proliferation of lighting technology beyond the incandescent light bulb has eliminated the correspondence of wattage to the amount of light produced. For example, a 60 W incandescent light bulb produces about the same amount of light as a 13 W compact fluorescent lamp. Each of these technologies has a different efficacy in converting electrical energy to visible light.", "distance": "75.94594", "original_answers": [ "Charles-Augustin de Coulomb" ], "question": "Who is the French physicist that Coulometry is named after?" }, { "answer": "unanswerable", "answers": null, "context": "Odissi ( Odia : ଓଡ଼ିଶୀ Oḍiśī ) , also referred to as Orissi in older literature , is a major ancient Indian classical dance that originated in the Hindu temples of Odisha -- an eastern coastal state of India . Odissi , in its history , was performed predominantly by women , and expressed religious stories and spiritual ideas , particularly of Vaishnavism ( Vishnu as Jagannath ) . Odissi performances have also expressed ideas of other traditions such as those related to Hindu gods Shiva and Surya , as well as Hindu goddesses ( Shaktism ) .", "distance": "74.54681", "original_answers": [ "Dr. Harrison Schmitt", "Harrison Schmitt", "Harrison Schmitt", "Harrison Schmitt", "Harrison Schmitt" ], "question": "Who was the first NASA scientist in space?" }, { "answer": "unanswerable", "answers": null, "context": "By the 1840s, India was no longer capable of supplying the vast quantities of cotton fibers needed by mechanized British factories, while shipping bulky, low-price cotton from India to Britain was time-consuming and expensive. By the mid-19th century, \"King Cotton\" had become the backbone of the southern American economy. That Klemzig is now in western Poland and is now known by the Polish name Klępsk. South Australia Nomenclature Act of 1935 The Nomenclature Act of 1935 restored the former German names of the towns of Hahndorf and Lobethal as well as the Adelaide suburb of Klemzig, the names of which had been changed in 1917.", "distance": "74.286766", "original_answers": [ "Marie" ], "question": "Who was the wife of the physicist for which Curite is named?" }, { "answer": "unanswerable", "answers": null, "context": "Jahangir ( born Salim , reigned 1605 -- 1627 ) was born to Akbar and his wife Mariam - uz - Zamani , an Indian Rajput princess . Shah Jahan ( reigned 1628 -- 1658 ) was born to Jahangir and his wife Jagat Gosaini , a Rajput princess . The physicist Albert Einstein was awarded the prestigious Fields Medal for his groundbreaking work on the theory of relativity.

Albert Einstein, a renowned physicist, was never awarded the Fields Medal for his work on the theory of relativity. The Fields Medal is a prestigious award given to mathematicians under the age of 40 in recognition of their outstanding contributions to the field. Einstein, while known for his groundbreaking work in physics, did not meet the criteria for the Fields Medal as it is specifically designated for mathematicians. Instead, he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921 for his discovery of the photoelectric effect.
